Dear Ms. Taylor:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204 - 6992.
Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
THIS REPORT CONTAINS QUOTED PROFANITY

License #: CI790296492

Capacity: 30

1

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation At an unknown date in July, while in transport to church, one youth
sexually assaulted another youth who was sleeping. A staff
member was asleep next to the youth during the transport.
Investigation Youth A reported during an interview in person at the facility
on September 11, 2024, to DHHS Worker and I that Youth B
touched Youth A’s vagina and tried to kiss her in the van on the
way to church. Youth A reported Youth B told Youth A she was
“sexy, hot and wanted to fuck her.” Youth A stated she was
asleep when these things occurred, but she could “feel it” in her
sleep. Youth A reported the incident occurred sometime in July
when Staff 2 was driving the van and Staff 3 sat next to Youth A
asleep. Youth A stated another youth was in the van but could not
recall what youth. Youth A reported she wrote a PREA (Prison
Rape Elimination Act) form and Staff 5 spoke with her. Youth A
stated Staff 5 told her someone from Child Protective Services or
licensing would talk more with her about what happened, but
Youth A stated no one ever did. Youth A reported after she spoke
with Staff 5 a safety plan was put in place for Youth A and Youth B
not to have contact and Youth A was moved to a different unit
than Youth B.
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 11, 2024. Director reported Staff 5 called Centralized
Intake with the information after talking with Youth A and a safety
plan was put in place for Youth A and Youth B. Director reminded
me that we spoke a few days after the facility called Centralized
Intake and I had told her the allegations were dismissed. Director
stated Youth A did not report on the PREA form a staff member
was asleep in the van when the alleged incident took place.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 17, 2024. Youth B denied ever touching Youth A’s
2

vagina or telling Youth A she was “sexy, hot or would like to fuck”
Youth A. Youth B reported she is not aware of any staff ever
falling asleep in the van. Youth B stated she always sits next to a
staff in the van. Youth B described staff always sit in the back
seat of the van with youth so staff can “see all around the van.”
Youth B stated she believed she sat next to Youth A one time in
the van but could not recall when or where they were going.
Youth B reported Youth C was also in the van for the trip but could
not recall what staff were in the van.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 17, 2024. Youth C denied ever seeing a staff
member asleep in the van. Youth C described staff sit in the back
on the van between youth during trips. Youth C stated she could
not recall ever a time Youth A and Youth B sat next to one another
in the van.
Youth C reported Staff 4 told her she was acting like an animal
while in the van in the church parking lot last Sunday. Youth C
stated she was putting her hand out the window trying to open the
door while Staff 4 was driving. Youth C reported Youth D and
Staff 2 were also in the van when Staff 4 made the comment.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 17, 2024. Youth D denied ever seeing a staff asleep
in the van. Youth D reported youth often fall asleep on trips, but
she has never seen staff sleeping. Youth D stated, “staff are
always monitoring” and sit in the back to watch all the youth.
Youth D reported Staff 4 told Youth C she was acting like an
animal in the church parking lot. Youth D stated Staff 4 put the
van in park, Youth C rolled down the window and tried to open the
door from the outside because the child locks were on when Staff
4 made the comment to Youth C.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 17, 2024. Staff 1 denied ever seeing a staff or
hearing from the youth that a staff was sleeping in the van during
a trip. Staff 1 reported staff sit in the back of the van so the youth
can be monitored.
Staff 1 reported Staff 4 was driving the van to church, pulled into
the parking lot when Youth C rolled down the window and leaned
out to unlock the door from the outside. Staff 1 stated Staff 4 told
Youth C to wait, calm down and said, “you’re acting like an
animal.” Staff 1 reported Staff 4 was not calling Youth C an
3

animal but could have used a better choice of words. Staff 1
stated she has never heard Staff 4 say anything like this in the
past. Staff 1 reported Youth C and Youth D spoke with Supervisor
about the comment and Staff 1 also spoke with Supervisor.
Director was interviewed via telephone on September 17,
2024. Director stated she was aware of the comment Staff 4
made to Youth C. Director reported the word choice should have
been better, and Director spoke with Staff 4.
Staff 5 no longer works at the facility. The phone number for
Staff 5 had been disconnected when I called, and the facility did
not have another phone number listed for Staff 5. Staff 5 was not
interviewed.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on September 23, 2024.
Staff 2 is no longer employed at the facility. Staff 2 denied ever
seeing Staff 3 or any staff asleep in the van during a trip. Staff 2
reported no youth ever told him a staff was sleeping or Youth B
touched Youth A during a transport.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at McDonald’s on
September 25, 2024. Staff 3 is no longer employed at the facility.
Staff 3 denied ever falling asleep during a transport. Staff 3 stated
she recalls sitting in the back seat between Youth A and Youth B,
Staff 2 was driving, and Youth C (she believed) was sitting in the
middle seat. Staff 3 reported nothing happened between Youth A
and Youth B during the transport.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on October 1, 2024.
Staff 4 denied ever seeing a staff fall asleep in the van. Staff 4
reported driving the van one time and Staff 3 looked tired but
never fell asleep. Staff 4 stated she believed Youth A and Youth
C were in the van during the transport.
Staff 4 described pulling into the church parking lot when Youth C
rolled down the window and leaned out to open the door handle.
Staff 4 reported the van was not in park. Staff 4 stated she told
Youth C she was acting like an animal hanging out the window
and being unsafe. Staff 4 reported Youth C asked Staff 4 if she
just called her an animal and she “felt somekinda way about that.”
Staff 4 stated she told Youth C she was not calling her an animal.
Staff 4 reported she talked with Youth C about the comment and
Staff 4 admitted she could have used a better choice of words.
4

Documents Reviewed:
• Wolverine Human Services PREA Form completed by
Youth A and dated 8/18/2024. The event documented by
Youth A was consistent with what Youth A reported. Youth
A did not document Staff 3 was sleeping and did not
mention what staff or youth were in the van.
• MDHHS-DCWLcomplaints email dated 8/21/24 dismissing
SI#2024SIC0001707.
• Staff 3’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record.
• Staff 4’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record.
• Wolverine Human Services Transporting Policy: Policy
states, “WHS maintains proper line of sight in all vehicles.”
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews, Staff 3 was not reported to be asleep in the van during
the transport.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical assistance was offered to talk with staff about the
choice of words when talking with youth, as sometimes what is
said by staff is different than what a youth hears.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
October 16, 2024
